alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Park County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 02 at 1:35PM MDT until April 02 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SOUTH PARK... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SOUTH PARK... The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 214. * Timing...Unit 8 PM MDT this evening for the Red Flag Warning. From noon to 8 PM MDT Monday for the Fire Weather Watch. * Winds...For today, west 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. For Monday, southwest 25 to 35 mph, with gusts up to 50 mph. * Relative Humidity...10 to 15 percent this afternoon. 15 to 20% on Monday. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid fire spread. Avoid outdoor burning and any activities that may produce sparks.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
